newsitem.title: CHINA: China renames customs post after Hong Kong return.
newsitem.headline: China renames customs post after Hong Kong return.

text.p: China has renamed its customs office on the border with Hong Kong following the return of the former British colony to Beijing rule, the official Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.
The office in the southern city of Shenzhen, formerly known as the Kowloon Customs House, is now called the Shenzhen Customs House.
The Kowloon Customs House opened in 1887 with border posts on Boundary Street on the Kowloon peninsula -- which then separated British and Chinese territory, the news agency said.
After Britain obtained a 99-year lease of the New Territories in 1898, the border post moved to Shenzhen but retained its original name, it said.
Hong Kong, which became a Special Administrative Region of China on Tuesday, retains its own customs controls despite the end of colonial rule.
